Desc.10000: A simple armour crafted by stitching cured leather. The curing process hardens the leather making it better against slashes.
Desc.10001: One of the first things learnt by blacksmiths is chainmail armour. Increased protection from slashes and projectiles.
Desc.10002: Armour set made from iron cast in sand moulds. Solid armour blocks slash and pierce attacks but hinder movement.
Desc.10003: Low carbon content in the iron makes it akin to wood. The grain structure protects against slash and blunt attacks but breaks against pierce
Desc.10004: Mixing metals in the right proportions creates alloys that have superior qualities to any base metal. The conductive alloy channels energy around the user rather than through them.
Desc.10005: Armour worn by the castle guards. The Emperor contracts the most proficient blacksmiths in the land to mass produce these sets.
Desc.10006: Armour commonly found in the land of elves. It is said that elves detest physical fighting and rely on magic and ranged weapons for their fighting. The armour was clearly crafted with the intention of making and keeping distance from the enemy.
Desc.10007: Hardened armour from the land of brutes. Barbarians take pride in their thick headed, drunken brawls, this armour was created by a gentle brute when his father died in a tavern brawl to stop smashed skulls.
Desc.10008: Robes made for the monks at Mt.Hōshōji and Mt.Genkaiji. The fabric is cured over holy incense and fresh spring water, allowing it to resist curses and repel demons.
Desc.10009: Crude armour set made by skinning animals and stitching the skin together. Not as good as leather armour but would you rather get stabbed with it or without it?
Desc.10010: Battle armour from the land of reeds. Worn by Samurai, the armour symbolises pride and the Samurai code of honor: Benovelence, Courage, Respect, Honesty, Honor, Loyalty. The armour contains a chink for the samurai to perform Seppuku.
Desc.10011: Forged from Primordial Void leftover from Creation. Capable of absorbing energy and physical attacks. Created by The Emperor himself to bestow upon his feared Shadow Force.
Desc.10012: Made by the Master Blacksmith for the Knight Force. Capable of withstanding heavy attacks and fexible enough for mounted travel. The armour is so reliable that a band of 5 knights once defeated a 1500-stong invasion army.
Desc.10013: Robes worn by the commonfolk around <place>. The thin robes don't allow for much and are worthless in a fight. Very colorful fabric and patterns are embroidered to show the village it was created in.
Desc.10014: Plates hewn from Brimstone found in hell. Very heavy and immobile, causes wearer to heat up and burn over time. Can resist vey heavy attacks and ignore fire damage. Causes weak enemies to cower in terror.
Desc.10015: Hewn from  the scales of a dragon, the heavy armour deflects attacks and projectiles while being flexible and light. If made from scales from a live dragon, retains the characteristics of the dragon.
Desc.10016: Robes made by an aspiring wizard when he came across some monk robes. The process used removed the incense but allowed for the robes to channel magic allowwing it to be used as a catalyst for select spells.
Desc.10017: Plates made from the scales of a fallen Greatwyrm. It is said that the Greatwyrm was inhabiting the great pit for more than a thousand years before Malar hunted the creature in a battle that lasted 10 years.
Desc.10018: Fabric woven by the magic of Selùn, tranforming the moon rays into fibre that can be woven. Being of the moon it grants blessing of the Moon to the user. The magical fabric can render spells harmless and glows with radiant moonlight.
Desc.10019: Yogi Robes are granted by the High Priest of Mt.Genkaiji to the most accomplished monks. The thin fabric allows the yogis to be one with the environment before finally leaving everything. The robes are treated and blessed with The God of Pain's seal, causing increased damage from sources.
Desc.11000: A simple shield crafted by chopping and joining wood. Not the best bit of protection, but would you rather face a fireball? With a shield or bare handed.
Desc.11001: The dwarf blacksmith who was living at the border of a barbarian village saw the brutes returning from war with broken pieces of wood. He simply took some iron and reinforced the shield. The barbarians loved the shields so much the dwarf's statue is still standing at Bróðurland.
Desc.11002: Same idea as the wooden shield but with iron, some bright goblin stumbled upon an iron disk and stopped a direct hit from the club of a brute. Leading to the total discontinuation of wooden shields.
Desc.11003: Created when some hunters broke their shields and had to improvise with some animal hide.
Desc.11004: The dwarf who made the alloyed set had some alloy left over so he cast it in a shield mold. Deflects energy and blows.
Desc.11005: The master blacksmith once smelted 1000 Electrum pieces to create this beautiful shield which features the royal insignia in the center.
Desc.11006: The addition of a spring to the handle allows the shield to deflect thrust attacks and projectiles.
Desc.20000: The exact origins of the long bow is not known but the goblins and brutes swear it was the Elves.
Desc.20001: Created out of an Assassin's need for a discrete bow. The lower range allows for better stealth.
Desc.20002: A wizard learnt that curving the arms outward increases the speed of the projectile. The curving increases the size and weight of the bow.
Desc.20003: A bow whose string is made from the guts of sheep and cows. The sinew expands on its own and imparts extra force to the arrow.
Desc.20004: A complex bow that uses pulleys to reduce the bending of the arrow around the bow. Increases accuracy and reduces range.
Desc.20005: Basic slingshot made and used by children as a toy, makes for a low cost projectile launcher.
Desc.20006: Bow made for the use of Selùn. Converts arrows to moonrays that inflict holy damage. Selùn had once used this bow to imprison Lykanthros, God of were-animals.
Desc.20007: A Compound bow that uses pulley enhancements to increase accuracy and damage while reducing range further.
Desc.20008: A bow made from fortified alloy that was annealed over Blue Flame. Inflicts Blue Flame after a small delay.
Desc.21000: Bow created to be wielded by the largest barbarians, crafted from the wood of a single Ironwood tree and strung with steel wires. The bow requires the strength of a brute.
Desc.21001: Crafted during a giant storm, using the lightning from the storm to heat the metal. Used by Commander General Seraphina to bring on a storm that lasted 3 months.
Desc.21002: A Greatbow created from burnt wood from Ironwood tree. The charring reduces weight but makes the bow fragile.
Desc.21003: Analogus to the Icarus that flew too close to the sun, the sunbow has a very finicky firing pattern but allows for great range.
Desc.21004: Crafted with absolute Elven precision reducing fire rate but greatly increaing damage and range. Old dwarves recall of an arrow from the bow once travelled through 5 mountains.
Desc.22000: A mechanical contraption capable of firing bolts in a trigger mechanism.
Desc.22001: A crossbow attached to a handle and carrying arm that increases weight and increases fire rate and accuracy.
Desc.22002: Crafted by Dragon born blacksmith using the guts and glands of a fallen dragon. This crossbow can spit fire and has the highest projectile speed.
Desc.22003: A wise old inventor shrunk the design for the castle ballista into a handheld version, shoots bolts.
Desc.22004: A magazine and wind-up mechanism allows for the repeater to fire at an incredible rate. This technology was too advanced during its time for the army to handle, but the creator died before he got a chance to see it finished.
Desc.40000: The Academy Master stumbled upon some spells that were too powerful to be cast by hand. The Master devised a stong wooden stick from trees that grow in the Academy to channel the extra energy, resulting in the Wooden Staff
Desc.40001: Once the wooden staff was made, Warlocks looked to improve on it, leading to a crystal being added to the top acting as a lens to focus the energy.
Desc.40002: The mages required a staff that allowed for repeated casting of spells. Due to the nature of its production this staff is very brittle and cannot handle powerful spells.
Desc.40003: Charring the wood of the staff over the purifying fire, curing the wood purifies the energy. Boosts support spells but reduces potency of offensive spells.
Desc.40004: Standard issue staff offered to the students of the Academy for them to practice and try out spells. The Master always insisted the students have access to the best staffs to allow them to learn and experiment on their own.
Desc.40005: One day in the Academy, A mysterious pure steel bar was found by The Warlock General in the main hall, who was later found unconcious next to it. When he woke up the staff was attached to his hand. His immense power flowed through the staff creating one of the few Primestaffs.
Desc.40006: Once used by the Chief Mage of the Emperor's army, this sceptor was hailed as the source of his power, until he cast it aside in favour of a simple wooden staff proving his stregnth. Warlocks theorise the staff must have gained some powers being in his presence for so long.
Desc.40007: Made by encasing a single tear from the Scared Willow into the heart of the staff which made it almost ghostlike. It slips through the hand of anyone who is not its owner and can only be held if it has been passed down from its owner.
Desc.40008: Created when The Emperor conjured the power of the cosmos. The staffs still contain memories and charactaristics of their celestial origin.
Desc.40009: The staff used by an elf that was touched by corruption. The corruption seeped through her body and entered the staff causing it to go dark. Aerin never wished harm on anyone, she was hailed as the purest of all Elves; but such is the power of corruption.
Desc.40010: When an adventuring young wizard was accidentally teleported to hell, he threw his staff into a lava pool. Over time the lava hardened around the staff creating a thick shell of brimstone. Very heavy but makes it easier to cast fire incantations.
Desc.40011: A staff that has been touched by corruption turns black. Corruption is the highest form of heresy and evil, corrupting everything it touches. It is observed that inanimate objects are not affected by corruption, does this mean that staffs have souls?
Desc.40012: A sceptor cast out of pure gold to be given as gift to The Emperor, but the gift was rejected. The Mages who made it casted 15 more and started a rebellion. It is said each of the staff gained an affinity to the power of the Mage using it.
Desc.40013: Forged from rock harvested from the core of an asteroid that fell to the lands over 5000 years ago. The alloy like material was never seen in this world before, causing it to behave unpredictably with magic of this world.
Desc.40014: Death is hailed as the great liberator, severing the suffering of the body and freeing the soul. Nonetheless the people who bring about death uninvited are sinners to the highest degree. A staff touched by death brings death
Desc.40015: A cane like staff awarded to Warlocks who have passed the training of the Academy. Even if Warlocks use other staffs they never discard their cane. No one knows whether it is out of old memories or its power.
Desc.40016: One of the handful of Primestaffs, this Staff was used by Hiddurel to spread corruption through the lands. Old tales say it is the only way to control the corruption, but no one can trust 1000 years of heresy.
Desc.40017: Legends tell of a sorceress named Lyra, who communed with the spirits of the night and bestowed her essence upon the staff. It is believed that her power is woven into its very fibers, granting the wielder The Blessing of the Night.
Desc.41000: A simple wand made from oak found near the Academy with a silverstring core. It is a smaller version of the wand to allow the use of simple spells while saving space and weight.
Desc.41001: Charring the wood over the purifying fire creates a wand that is very potent with offensive spells, why it behaves completely opposite to its staff counterpart is not known by even the greatest warlocks.
Desc.41002: Wand made from the wood of a burning Ironwood tree. The amount of energy and wood in the tree makes it burn for 5 days, but the wands can only be made during a small 5 minute window. Boosts fire spells.
Desc.41003: A wand created by the Soulkeeper to be given to his most trusted assassins. A marvel in wand design, it is said to house the souls  of heros who tried to challenge the Soulkeeper. Sometimes, during silence, the screams of the imprisoned soul can be faintly heard.
Desc.41004: Wand made from a singular crystal lattice with elven precision. Very fragile but streamlines the casting of spells,
Desc.41005: Wand fashioned like a scythe, said to steal the souls of whom it kills. An experienced mage can trap the soul in the wand and may be able to return it to a new body using some of the lifesource of the user.
Desc.41006: A warlock once made a wand from the brances of The Weeping Willow. The wand is described to take on the personality of the user, sometimes taking over the users mind.
Desc.41007: A simple oak want fitted with a very thin core of Amethyst, acts like a conduit allowing higher amounts of energy than normal to be projected.
Desc.41008: There are many a fate worse than death, but death is feared most because it is inevitable. A wand created by death brings corruption and misery, but death liberates all.
Desc.41009: Wand forged from alloys made by melting many sacred chronographs, the wand is imbued with the power to perform complicated time manipulations
Desc.41010: The black void blade is inscribed with the poem: 'In shadows deep, where silence weaves, Nightkiss whispers, as darkness cleaves. A wand of death where terror conceives, echoes of nightmare, the darkness grieves'
Desc.42000: A seal minted in the halls of the academy. Grants an inexperienced user to use complex spelld reliably but reduces its potency. It is used in the Academy to train novince users before they have the power to do so.
Desc.42001: 'A Hearth is not just a place where a home resides, it is anywhere we can let our guard down in the trust of others'. The Hearthstone seal is made from the stones kept in the town hearth. It can recognise the child of its town and grants aid when needed.
Desc.42002: The tube-like heart of Arachne, changed by the magic of an old mage to channel energy rather than blood and encased in the stone like hardened silk of 1000 spiders. The essence of Arachne still remains in this cursed object, possibly channeling her power.
Desc.42003: A seal granted by Auril, An icy cold six-pointed snowflake that can summon the power of winter briefly. The delicate structure changes ever so slightly every winter and never keeps the same shape twice.
Desc.42004: A blank scroll symbolising the perfect medium for the flow of knowledge. Granted by Fiachra, it can be used to improve focus and lessen the burden of intelligence required to cast spells. The scroll can sometimes be heard, whispering unfathomable knowledge in an unknown language.
Desc.42005: An unblinking eye found on the person of Gruumsh after defeating him in a hand-to-hand duel. Said to witness all, see all and know all, provides battle sense and primal instinct to the user. Seems to abhor the touch of any who is not of its kind.
Desc.42006: The seal of Reorx, God of Craft. Fashioned as a smithing hammer, it is naturally very heavy to wield. Can be used as a weapon or used to boost crafting.
Desc.42007: Made from a claw seared off a live ancient dragon, retains its lifeforce after the dragon has died and can channel a part of the dragons power.
Desc.50000: A long straightsword from the land of humans. Used by the calvalrymen to fight plate or mail armour. Used by the spainards to finish off bulls after a bullfighting round.
Desc.50001: A heavy Longsword with a history written in blood. Used by Swiss and German mercenaries to fight against pike formations, the Zweihander soon found many applications after it was used by The General to slay a dragon. The design of the blade requires pure strength to wield.
Desc.50002: A long sword obtained from Nippon, the Odachi is useful for quickly finishing a fight. Usually carried on the back, it is only drawn with the intention of ending the fight or used on horseback due to its long reach.
Desc.50003: Sword from the Great Empire of Rome, used by light infantry as a primary weapon and in gladiatory fights. The unconventional design made it very inefficient for combat but good for a thrust that pierces armour.
Desc.50004: The Chinese Jian is considered the gentlemen of weapons as it requires dexterity and skill to use, making it the weapon of choice for duels. They are usually used as training swords to allow the user to attain the skill required to gracefully wield many kinds of sword.
Desc.50005: The English longsword was used during the medivial ages of earth around the United Kingdom. Brought to <World> when a few cavalry knights landed in <Town>. The knights went on to become part of The Emperor's Elite guard due to their training and prificiency in
Desc.50006: According to the damascus method, a metal is folded in half many times giving it a beautiful pattern and making the blade flexible enough for parrying while retaining enough rigidity to perform a thrust attack. According to dwarves a good damascus blade has more than 500,000 folds, saying it imparts character to the blade.
Desc.50007: A large lump of fine iron shaped into a sword. Weilded by the strongest of beings, the inertia of the blade ensures the sword goes through whatever is being sliced. The heavy blade requires the sword to be used in a continuous combo or suffer a long recovery time.
Desc.51000: A big heavy axe, previously used by orc timbermen, it found its uses in other areas once creatures strong enough to wield it came up.
Desc.51001: A spear and an axe in one weapon, the Halberd is made light to allow a manuverable but robust spear to combo with the axe. The spear is very useful to combo with the axe and can be used to keep enemies at a distance.
Desc.51002: A Halberd forged from hardened gold. The edge of the blade is encased in
Desc.51003: Created from wings ripped off the back of an Angel and dipped in gold. The iridecent blade glows with a golden hue. Angels are said to be the messengers and workers of the Gods, going around the lands and spreading the word of their patron God. The Angels are not particularly hostile to creatures not of their patronage but don't take lightly to unprovoked agression.
Desc.51004: A nice hefty axe brought over by vikings. A fine tool for finishing animals knocked by arrows or pillaging villages. Like the Greatsword its inertia will hack through the hardest armour with ease.
Desc.51005: A small Hatchet that is fitted with a spring mechanism to deliver blows with more energy. The weapon doesnt use magic so it has to be reloaded by hand, increasing recovery time.
Desc.51006: An axe whose edge has been dipped into melted sulpher. The porous nature of the metal allows the sulpher to seep into the blade, making it noxious and toxic to any creature not used to the element.
Desc.52000: A simple weapon made from steel, good for slashing and slicing fast.
Desc.52001: Wrought iron is flexible, increases parrying capabilities but may get deformed fast.
Desc.52002: Arming swords are usually used in one on one duals, the blade can be used to reach into the guard of other blades and disarm them.
Desc.52003: Basically a sword mounted on a pole, this weapon is used to keep and deal with enemies at a distance.
Desc.52004: The most common form of katana used for combat in Nippon, it is worn on the side and drawin in battle. Using the Uchigatana is a work of art as much as it is a display of skill. It has a very complex ettiquete and maintaining routine, but will never give up on its wielder in combat.
Desc.52005: A katana that is purified and coated with the blue flame, the flame deals fire damage over time and cannot be extinguished by water. The saya of this katana was crafter by the dwarves to withstand the heat of the flame without burning the user.
Desc.52006: Katana made by quenching white-hot steel in ice cold water, causing tension in the steel. Out of every hundred blades quenched, hardly 3 manage to qualify to be made into a weapon capable of combat. The tension in the blade causes the energy from any strike to be redirected outwards.
Desc.52007: A sword that is meant only for thrusting, the steel poker doesnt have an edge but the dwarves who made it say it has a very good point.
Desc.52008: A katana forged from steel then cooled in ice water from the mountains. The internal tensions pull the steel together and create a edge so sharp it can slice the air it passes through.
